12.3.7.8.2 Overflight of Iran/Tehran FIR	
	
Communication	
Ensure compliance with Air Defence Identification Zone (ADIZ) restrictions and Communication requirements listed in LIDO RM CRAR – Iran.	
	
Approved Routes	
It is important that crews follow the published route unless required to deviate for safe flight (i.e. weather avoidance). Iran CAA and ATC may offer shortcuts or alternative routings with radar vectors off route for short term tactical ATC separation or to support crew request for weather avoidance. Crews should return to the flight planned route/airway as soon as practicable.	
	
Minimum Flight Level	
FL250 except during climb or descent.	
	
Contingencies	
En-route diversions for non-critical emergencies (e.g. medical) whilst transiting Tehran FIR should be planned outside Tehran FIR. In an emergency that requires immediate decision, the pilot in command, in the interest of safety, may deviate from these requirements to the extent required by that emergency.	
	
MEL Restrictions	
In addition to normal MEL requirements, the following systems must be serviceable for dispatch for flights from DXB and airborne failures should be managed as per standard practice:	
	
Transponder	
	
At least one long range comms system (HF or SATCOM)

Name: ATYRAU
Class\/AIRFIELD CAT\/RFF: — / - /CAT 8, OPS HR not published.​ CAT 9, O/R
CCI:
Use EMERG FREQ 121.500 with other ACFT and ATS units, guard the FREQ of ATR DVOR​ for getting information and instructions of air traffic controller.​
When flying at night, indicate the location of ACFT by periodically turning on LDG lights or​ by flashing side lights.
•​ Report RWY vacated after reaching STOP line.​
Warnings​
Caution Notes​
Birds in vicinity of AD.​
Arrival Procedure​
Continuous Descent Operations (CDO)​
CDOs are performed during periods of low traffic density at ATC discretion and only on​
GNSS RNAV1 STARs.​
CDOs are authorized only when following conditions are respected:​
•​ ILS of RWY intended for landing is in operation;​
•​ no adverse weather conditions that may affect CDO;​
•​ no system degradations that may affect GNSS or ILS operation.​
After receiving “WHEN READY DESCEND TO (LEVEL)” or “DESCEND TO (LEVEL) AT PILOTS​ DISCRETION” clearance the pilot is allowed to plan/optimize vertical profile in order to​
apply CDO to FAP.​
Depending on traffic, CDO may start from TOD or lower levels.​
CDO can be performed when ACFT is cleared to a waypoint or via a combination of​
waypoints for direct routing/shortcut and the horizontal trajectory is defined up to the FAP.​
Thus, the exact distance to RWY is known and the descent profile can be calculated.​
Specified minimum level at waypoint must be adhered to, unless specifically cancelled by​
ATC.​
When radar vectors are issued or expected, ATC will provide an estimated track DIST from​
touchdown
